entry.title: I have an Octopress!
entry.content:
So, as part of our first class, we had to create our own Octopress Blog. “Octopress is a framework designed by Brandon Mathis for Jekyll, the blog aware static site generator powering Github Pages.”

Settimg it up was fairly straightforward.

First —

git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git octopress
cd octopress
bundle install
bundle exec rake install

Next —

Set up a repo on Github named yourusername.github.io

Then back in Terminal —

rake setup_github_pages
rake generate
rake deploy

If you go to yourusername.github.io, you should see your blog! (It can take up to 10 minutes…)

Create a new blog post —

rake new_post["This is the title of my first Blog post!]

Edit the markdown file, and then commit the changed files!

If at any time you want to view your blog without having to actually deploy it, you can do so by running…

rake generate
rake preview

Then go to http://localhost:4000/ in your browser.

When your blog is looking how you’d like it to look, simply

rake generate
rake deploy

to send it off to the interwebs.

Ta daa!!
